content: lacy granny square fingerless mittens/wrist warmers pattern by milly hello thank you so much for using my pattern and i am sorry if it isn t very well designed as this is my first ever pattern created if you can please leave a comment and let me know what you think of this pattern happy crocheting follow me on instagram @millycrochets_ note this pattern is written in us crochet terms i have written some extra notes so check out for these * materials used 100% acrylic yarn 4ply you can use any 4ply yarn to your liking though i recommend acrylic cotton or wool 4mm hook 3 5 mm hook darning needle scissors abbreviation slip_stitch - slip_stitch chain - chain single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet double_crochet cluster stitch - cs back loop only - blo cluster stitch for this pattern 1 yarn over to create a loop on hook like a regular double_crochet 2 insert hook into stitch yarn over and pull through 3 yarn over only pull through the first two loops on hook this creates a half finishes double_crochet 4 yarn over to create another loop 5 insert hook into stitch again yarn over and pull through 6 again pull through the first two loops only 7 repeat the process of 4-6 once again yarn over and pull through all 4 loops on the hook youtube tutorial on how to cluster stitch granny square 4mm/larger hook base chain 4 you can chain more or less to make the granny square slightly bigger/smaller to fit your size slip_stitch into first chain round 1 chain 3 to add height 16 double_crochet into ring slip_stitch into first double_crochet 16 round 2 chain 3 this will count as a double_crochet and ch2 double_crochet ch2 into blo * repeat until end of round slip_stitch into 3rd chain round 3 slip_stitch into next chain 2 gap chain 2 part of cs and finish cs ch3 cs chain 3 into the next chain gap repeat until end of round slip_stitch into first cs round 4 slip_stitch into next chain gap chain 2 part of cs and finish cs chain 6 cs into same gap chain 4 single_crochet into next gap ch4 x3 cs into next gap chain 6 cs into same gap chain 4 single_crochet into next gap chain 4 x3 repeat x3 and until round ends optional was not necessary for me round 5 slip_stitch into corner gap chain 1 single_crochet 1 into same gap chain 4 single_crochet 1 again into same gap chain 4 single_crochet 1 x 3 chain 4 x 4 slip_stitch back into first single_crochet fasten_off and weave in ends create 4 of these granny squares for two mittens *to make it more stable as doing blo makes the stitches loose insert the hook into the loop behind the bl as well as the bl when doing a double_crochet attaching granny squares together 4mm hook 1 line up the granny squares back to back* 2 insert hook into corner gap
